Authors: Candra S., Valtin E.I., Agustine R.T.
Title: E-Service Quality of Online Transportation in Indonesia: A Preliminary Finding
Source title: 2019 7th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management, CITSM 2019
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Candra, S., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Valtin, E.I., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Agustine, R.T., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is knowing the condition of E-Service Quality, Trust, Customer Satisfaction, Loyalty Customer and in the Online Transportation competition. Knowing the effect of E-Service Quality on Customer Satisfaction. Knowing the effect of E-Service Quality on Trust. Knowing the effect of E-Service Quality on Customer Loyalty. Knowing the influence of Trust on Customer Satisfaction. Knowing the effect of Customer Satisfaction on Customer Loyalty. Knowing the Effect of E-Service Quality on Customer Satisfaction through Trust. The method used is Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) by collecting data using a questionnaire. The results of the study state that E-Service Quality has a positive effect on Customer Loyalty with the mediation of Customer Satisfaction on Online Transportation users in Indonesia. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Customer Loyalty; Customer Satisfaction; E-Service Quality; Online Transportation; Trust
Index Keywords: Quality of service; Sales; Customer loyalty; E-service quality; Indonesia; Structural equation modeling; Trust; Customer satisfaction
